remarks: Weaken the condition of ~ isnsg to only one side of the implication. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:
isnsg.1 $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
isnsg.2 $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
isnsg2 $p |- ( S e. ( NrmSGrp ` G ) <-> ( S e. ( SubGrp ` G ) /\ A. x e. X A. y e. X ( ( x .+ y ) e. S -> ( y .+ x ) e. S ) ) ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d x y $.
